title: Binders
abstract: An un-reacted substantially formaldehyde free curable binder solution for binding loose matter consists essentially of a solution obtainable by dissolving a reducing sugar, an ammonium salt acid precursor, optionally a carboxylic acid or a precursor thereof and optionally ammonia in water.

operation: How does the product or process operate?

The product operates by binding non-woven mineral fibers together using a cured, substantially formaldehyde-free, nitrogenous polymer-containing binder. The binder solution consists of reducing sugars, ammonium salts, and other components. The product achieves a non-woven mineral fiber insulation material with controlled ionic species levels, specific density, thermal conductivity, and parting strength. It is substantially formaldehyde-free and has a nitrogenous polymer-containing binder that binds the fibers together.
